\subsection{Cone}
\begin{definition}[Cone\index{Cone}]\label{def:cone}
	For categories $C,D$ and a functor $F:C\to D$. A cone over the
	diagram (functor) $F$ consists of an object $d\in D$ and a family of morphisms
	$\big(d_c: d \to F(c)\big)_{c\in C}$ such that for each $(f:c\to c')\in C,\
	(\forall c,c'\in C)$ the following commutes:
	\parencite{awodey:category_theory}

	% https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsMyxbMCwwLCJkIl0sWzAsMSwiRihjKSJdLFsxLDEsIkYoYycpIl0sWzAsMiwiZF97Yyd9Il0sWzAsMSwiZF9jIiwyXSxbMSwyLCJGKGYpIiwyXV0=
	\[\begin{tikzcd}
		d \\
		{F(c)} & {F(c')}
		\arrow["{d_{c'}}", from=1-1, to=2-2]
		\arrow["{d_c}"', from=1-1, to=2-1]
		\arrow["{F(f)}"', from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\end{tikzcd}\]
\end{definition}

\begin{example}
	% https://q.uiver.app/?
	\[\begin{tikzcd}
		&&&& d \\
		a && b & {F(a)} && {F(b)} \\
		& c &&& {F(c)}
		\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=24pt}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-4]
		\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-24pt}, dotted, from=2-3, to=2-6]
		\arrow["{d_a}"', from=1-5, to=2-4]
		\arrow["{d_b}", from=1-5, to=2-6]
		\arrow["{d_c}"{pos=0.1}, from=1-5, to=3-5]
		\arrow["f", from=2-1, to=2-3]
		\arrow["h", from=2-3, to=3-2]
		\arrow["{F(g)}"', from=2-4, to=3-5]
		\arrow["{F(f)}", from=2-4, to=2-6]
		\arrow["g"', from=2-1, to=3-2]
		\arrow["{F(h)}", from=2-6, to=3-5]
		\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=24pt}, dotted, from=3-2, to=3-5]
	\end{tikzcd}\]
\end{example}

\begin{remark}
	Definition \ref{def:cone} can be expressed simply as a natural transformation
	$\alpha: \Delta_d \Rightarrow F$ from the constant functor, where $d$ is the
	apex of the cone.
\end{remark}
